P2 Edge Breakout Board (#64029)
Features
The P2 Edge Breakout Board provides a compact interface to the P2 Edge Module for experimenting and developing with the Propeller 2 microcontroller.

potential_captions: Web Store: www.parallax.com Tutorials: learn.parallax.com Sales: sales@parallax.com Tech Support: support@parallax.com
P2 Edge Breakout Board (#64029)

context.caption: Web Store: www.parallax.com Tutorials: learn.parallax.com Sales: sales@parallax.com Tech Support: support@parallax.com

nearby_text.text: The board accepts the P2 Edge Module (#P2-EC) and includes a supply voltage DC Jack socket, power headers, Parallax Prop Plug (#32201) programming header, and reset button.

All 64 of the P2 Edge Smart I/O pins are available at eight 0.1” pin header sockets, compatible with both single and dual header Propeller 2 accessories. All accessory headers are arranged to accept single or dual P2 accessory boards. The last header includes the programming and memory pins (58-63) and reset signal (RES) for wireless programming when using the P2 WX Adapter (#64007) with Parallax WX ESP8266 SIP module (#32420S).
The P2 Edge Breakout Board provides a compact interface to the P2 Edge Module for experimenting and developing with the Propeller 2 microcontroller.
P2 Edge Breakout Board (#64029)

● Vertical socket for the Parallax P2 Edge Module (#P2-EC) ● Solder-free prototyping, header sockets for power, programming and I/O ● Center-positive 2.1 mm barrel jack for external 5 VDC power supply ● Flexible 0.1” 2x3 way power header allows use of an external switch or power supply ● Convenient reset button ● All 64 Smart I/O pins brought out to 0.1” 2x6 way P2 accessory headers ● Dedicated Parallax Prop Plug (#32201) header, for system programming and debugging

potential_captions: Web Store: www.parallax.com Tutorials: learn.parallax.com Sales: sales@parallax.com Tech Support: support@parallax.com
P2 Edge Breakout Board (#64029)

nearby_text.text: When connecting your P2 Edge Module to the P2 Edge Breakout Board, ensure that the module is inserted with the orientation hole on the module closest to the white orientation circle that is marked on the breakout PCB, close to the bottom-left side of the Edge Socket.  Correct module orientation is shown in this image:
Orientation

1. Parallax P2 Edge Module Socket
Feature Descriptions
The P2 Edge Module socket is a 0.05 in (1.27 mm) pitch, 80-way vertical socket. Refer to Edge Connector Pin Assignments in the P2 Edge Module product guide for full details.
2. Power Jack

context.caption: Feature Descriptions

nearby_text.text: CAUTION! The P2 Edge Module power input pads have reverse polarity protection, but damage could occur from user circuits attached to the IO pins incorrectly, so care should always be taken to ensure correct orientation.
CAUTION! Always use a well-regulated power supply and do not exceed 5.5 VDC input!
The P2 Edge Module must be inserted with its orientation hole closest to the RESET Button, and aligned with the white orientation ring that is marked on the breakout board.

context.caption: 3. Prop Plug Programming Header

nearby_text.text: 5. Power Header

Each jumper could be replaced with a switch or could be used to supply power directly to the breakout board (instead of using the DC Barrel Jack). This is an unsupported customer option - please refer to the silk labeling on the bottom of the breakout board and the schematic for further information.
To disable power only for the accessory header 5V pins, remove the bottom “HDR 5V ON” jumper.
6. I/O Pin Accessory Headers (with 5V output)
The 0.1” pitch 2x3 way power header comes with two pre-installed 2-pin shunts to enable power to the breakout board.

potential_captions: 3. Prop Plug Programming Header
5. Power Header
The 0.1” pitch 2x3 way power header comes with two pre-installed 2-pin shunts to enable power to the breakout board.

context.caption: 6. I/O Pin Accessory Headers (with 5V output)

nearby_text.text: 6. I/O Pin Accessory Headers (with 5V output)
With the P2 Edge Module plugged in, each of the Propeller 2's 64 smart I/O pins connect to an accessory header, in specific groups of eight.

Each edge header provides two GND connections, a Vxx output pin supplying the voltage from the corresponding 3.3 V LDO voltage regulator ( described here ), and optionally a 5 V output that is connected via the  Power Header  directly to the  Power Jack .

PRO TIP: REMOVE THE HDR 5V ON JUMPER IF YOU ARE NOT USING THE 5V SUPPLY AT THE 2X6 WAY ACCESSORY HEADERS.  Doing so will reduce the risk of accidentally causing damage during experimentation; for example, should one of the 5V pins be accidentally connected to a signal or ground pin. All I/O signal pins are rated for 3.3V only!
Copyright © Parallax Inc. P2 Edge Breakout Board (#64029) v1.0  03/01/2023  Page 5 of 11

potential_captions: 6. I/O Pin Accessory Headers (with 5V output)
With the P2 Edge Module plugged in, each of the Propeller 2's 64 smart I/O pins connect to an accessory header, in specific groups of eight.

context.caption: DO NOT APPLY VOLTAGE TO THE Vxx Pin; it is a voltage output! Be aware that some I/O pins are also connected to other peripheral circuits; see the  Edge Connector Pin Assignments  section.

nearby_text.text: DO NOT APPLY VOLTAGE TO THE Vxx Pin; it is a voltage output! Be aware that some I/O pins are also connected to other peripheral circuits; see the  Edge Connector Pin Assignments  section.
5V OUTPUT VOLTAGE IS PROVIDED TO POWER EXTERNAL ACCESSORIES & SENSORS.  DO NOT CONNECT 5V DIRECTLY TO ANY OF THE P2 SMART I/O PINS!
ALL I/O PINS OPERATE AT 3.3V LOGIC LEVEL AND ARE NOT 5V TOLERANT !
7. I/O Pin Breakout Edge Headers (without 5V output)
There are two edge headers that do not have 5V routed to them, one for P24-–P31, and one for P56–P63.

context.caption: 7. I/O Pin Breakout Edge Headers (without 5V output)

nearby_text.text: VIO 3.3V Power and Ground (GND) access
Each group of 8 smart I/O pins has its own 3.3 V low-noise regulator, with short-circuit and over-current protection.  You may see this
The P56–P63 header is marked with the RES pin label beside the V56 pin.

The positive 3.3 V supply sockets and ground sockets are positioned around the board at the 2x6 way P2 accessory headers. The headers are compatible with the Parallax P2 accessory boards, or use jumper wires to connect the header pins to an external circuit- for example, to a breadboard.
The RES pin is active low, and is connected to the Propeller 2 microcontroller RESn circuit on the P2 Edge Module. Momentarily set this pin low to reset the Propeller 2.

context.caption: voltage referred to as VIO (Voltage for IO), and is labeled beside each group of I/O pins in the format Vxx.

nearby_text.text: Warning: DO NOT join the Vxx pins together. The voltage output is intended to provide logic level and low current supply only to the corresponding group of 8 I/Os (Maximum 30mA per pin, 300 mA total). If a larger current or common supply is required, use an alternative power source such as the Parallax Power Pal (#32133).
The two digits after the V refer to the first of 8 I/O pins that the LDO provides power to. For example in the image, V48 would mean VIO voltage for I/O pins 48 to 55.
